For to return to the myths‚ Neoptolemus could not have taken Troy if lie had been willing to listen to Lycomedes, at whose court he was brought up, when with many tears he tried to stop his journey. And often important matters befall, so that we have to part from our friends: and the man who wishes to obstruct these important matters, because he cannot easily endure to miss his friends, is both weak and effeminate by nature, and, for that very reason, far from reasonable in sriendship. 76. And so in everything you must consider both what you would ask from a friend, and what you would suffer to be obtained from yourself.
